result.execSummary:
The defendant Carol A Munden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 bail applied. Court grants payment plan of $100 per month beginning March 1, 2017. Failure to pay will result in one day in jail for every $25 outstanding.
Defendant to submit DNA sample within 30 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/conditions: no contact with any Piggly Wiggly grocery store

Defendant Carol A Munden in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant cancelled and cash bond refunded. State requests cash bond remain and defendant not to have any contact with any Piggly Wiggly. Court sets bail. Court advises of penalties and legal rights. Defendant ordered to contact public defenders office, if not eligible or defendant choses to not use a public defender, she must be prepared to represent herself at all future hearings.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
